title: PTD Today — Media

items.title: Build your first GraphRAG Powered Agent! (No Graph Expert Required) | Databases for AI

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the session explains that knowledge trapped in docs, PDFs, and wikis can be unlocked with knowledge graphs so AI models can reason over it. It demonstrates how to build a knowledge graph in an afternoon using the AI tools teams already use, with a live demo on real documents and no six-month project required.
bullets: Knowledge in docs, PDFs, and wikis is often inaccessible to models.
Knowledge graphs can unlock that information for AI reasoning.
Many teams avoid building graphs due to perceived complexity.
The session shows a fast, practical build using familiar AI tools.
Includes a live demo using real documents—no long project needed.
takeaways: Make operational documents (manuals, runbooks, specs) usable by AI for better decision support.
Achieve a working knowledge graph quickly—possible to build in an afternoon rather than months.
Leverage existing AI tools your team already uses to reduce implementation overhead.
Live-demo evidence suggests practical applicability to real documents without extended projects.

items.title: Watch Live: Fed Chair Jerome Powell Holds News Conference | WSJ

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell speaks to reporters following the Federal Reserve's two-day policy-setting meeting. The WSJ News video is live coverage of his post-meeting press conference; no transcript is available in the description.
bullets: Live press conference by Fed Chair Jerome Powell.
Occurs immediately after the Fed's two-day policy-setting meeting.
WSJ News providing live coverage.
No transcript is provided in the video description.
Content is Powell's post-meeting remarks and Q&A with reporters.
takeaways: Monitor Powell's post-meeting remarks for signals that could affect interest-rate expectations and financing costs for projects.
Watch for guidance that may influence market volatility and capital availability, which can affect investment timing.
Review project budgets and financing assumptions after Fed communications to ensure plans remain aligned with evolving monetary conditions.

items.title: Deutsche Bank accelerates Cloud journeys with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description… Google Cloud Consulting designed novel learning experiences that helped thousands of Deutsche Bank engineers become fluent in cloud engineering. They used Generative AI to create personalized, interactive training that combines on‑demand convenience with the effectiveness of instructor‑led sessions, with the Learning Services team providing the creative innovation and technical expertise to build the Deutsche Bank Cloud Engineering Program and massively accelerate their cloud journey.
bullets: Consulting designed novel learning experiences for Deutsche Bank engineers.
Generative AI was used to create personalized, interactive training at scale.
Training blended on‑demand learning with instructor‑led sessions.
Google Cloud Consulting Learning Services provided creative and technical expertise.
The program aimed to massively accelerate Deutsche Bank's cloud journey.
takeaways: Investing in tailored training can accelerate enterprise cloud adoption and engineer fluency.
Generative AI enables scalable, personalized learning that combines convenience with instructor guidance.
A blended on‑demand plus instructor‑led approach can improve training effectiveness for complex cloud skills.
Partnering with specialized consulting teams provides the creative and technical capabilities needed to build enterprise cloud programs.
Workforce readiness programs are a key lever to hasten cloud migration and transformation efforts.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This PwC Year-end toolkit episode focuses on strengthening finance teams' collaboration with audit committees during the year-end accounting and reporting process. It addresses preparing for key year-end issues and expanding oversight areas such as AI (risks, opportunities, controls), enterprise risk management, evolving cyber risk in the age of AI, and elevating proxy disclosures.
bullets: Guidance on improving management / audit committee communication and collaboration.
Key year-end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address.
Oversight considerations for AI, including risks, opportunities, and controls.
Approaches to enhance enterprise risk oversight.
Navigating cyber risk in the context of AI and elevating proxy disclosures.
takeaways: Keep audit committees informed about AI use, associated risks, and controls affecting operations and reporting.
Prioritize cyber risk updates that consider AI-driven threats and governance implications.
Align enterprise risk oversight and transformation initiatives with audit-committee reporting expectations and year-end timelines.
Prepare clear, concise year-end disclosures (including proxy disclosures) to support governance and stakeholder oversight.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video highlights that route planning is made easy as Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups. The short description frames Copilot Groups as a helpful capability for organizing routes and collaboration.
bullets: Route planning made easy
Jo discovers Copilot Groups
Emphasis on the 'power' of Copilot Groups
Brief promotional description
Includes hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai
takeaways: If route planning is part of your grid/data-center operations, Copilot Groups are presented as a tool worth exploring.
Copilot Groups may help simplify organizing routes and coordinating field teams.
Consider evaluating Copilot Groups in pilot tests for route scheduling or crew coordination.
The feature is positioned as a productivity aid for route-centric workflows.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, KPMG ON AIR hosts a conversation with Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska about how AI is already embedded in audit work. They discuss practical tools (transaction scoring, Clara AI assistants and agents), KPMG Clara platform and Clara for Clients, the move from sampling to full-population analysis, changing auditor competencies, implementation challenges, data security, regulatory issues and future risks/benefits.
bullets: AI supports repetitive audit tasks and enables analysis of entire data populations (AI Transaction Scoring Tool).
Clara AI acts as a conversational assistant with specialized agents to aid auditors.
AI helps with documentation and disclosure analysis, and KPMG Clara manages audits in real time.
Clara for Clients modernizes client communication and collaboration during audits.
Discussion covers auditor role changes, skill needs, implementation challenges, data security, regulation and potential AI risks.
takeaways: Prepare infrastructure for increased data processing and storage as audits move toward full-population AI analyses.
Ensure secure, compliant environments and strong data governance to meet regulatory and client-security expectations.
Support platform integration and high availability to enable real-time audit tools and client-facing solutions like Clara for Clients.
Plan for change management and training as auditor roles shift to using AI assistants and specialized agents.
Adopt model- and process-level governance to mitigate AI-related risks highlighted during implementation.
